review: Reese Witherspoon stars as a perky, studious go-getting teenager in this 1999 film with Matthew Broderick as her dedicated history teacher and school adviser, well-liked by students and administration The film becomes somewhat awry when Broderick's friend, a math teacher at the school, has a fling with Witherspoon and is forced to resign.When the guy's wife divorces him and leaves town, Broderick comes on to the wife and this destroys his marriage.In between all this mess there is a student election and we all know the types of speeches that are made by those running at these times.Broderick's downfall in the film is ridiculous. There is no teacher that would discard ballots during an election.Too many problems are just skirted over- a girl being a lesbian and being adopted are just two.
